alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 01 at 5:09AM AKST until March 01 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A storm force low over northern gulf coast will stall out during the day on Wednesday. Temperatures currently below freezing with dewpoints in the 20s will rise through the day. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 8 inches have been reported over the northern inner channels and portions of the central inner channels early Wednesday morning. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals for the southern half of the panhandle as southerly flow will cause a mix of rain/snow or even a complete change to rain through Wednesday evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Central inner channels. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall expected through Wednesday morning. Snow could mix with rain Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
